definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Keeping Ten Precepts can help us to get out of the Samsara.
sentences.chinese: 守十善只能生天界而守十戒能出离世间。

sentences.english: Moses received the Ten Commandments from God on Mount Sinai.
sentences.chinese: 在西奈山上他从上帝那里接受了十戒。

sentences.english: Today, let me give you those Ten Commandments.
sentences.chinese: 今天，就让我将那十戒传授给大家吧。

sentences.english: Good, 'cause the Ten Commandments don't mean a box of piss in here.
sentences.chinese: 很好，因为十戒在这里狗屁不值。

sentences.english: Moses goes up the mountain a second time to get a replacement set of the Ten Commandments.
sentences.chinese: 摩西第二次到山上去拿另一块刻有十戒的石板。

sentences.english: Of course, this includes the Ten Commandments found in Exodus 20.
sentences.chinese: 无疑这其中包括出埃及记20中的十戒。

definition: to go against the rules (of a religious order)/to break a ban (e.g. medical)
to abstain from/to prohibit (certain foods etc)
the Three Pillars of Faith (Buddha, dharma, sangha)/see also 三寶|三宝[san1 bao3]
(Buddhism) to adhere strictly to the ethical precepts/asceticism
